numbered_ace_sentences: 2. The survey data is about young adults and adults.
3. Each young adult is between 15 years and 24 years old.
4. Each adult is 40 years old or older.
5. The survey measures the percentage of young adults who think that the world is becoming a better place with each generation.
6. The survey measures the percentage of adults who think that the world is becoming a better place with each generation.
7. The survey does not cover an ample sample size.
8. The graph can serve as a possible answer to questions about changes in the world over the past 25 years.
9. We have knowledge about what is happening around the globe now.
10. Based on the survey data and this knowledge, we can make a rough guess about the status quo of each country in the survey list.
12. This rough guess can help us to understand the world better.
13. The survey data represents the voice of citizens of each country.
14. We should doubt the accuracy of the survey results.
15. An insignificant sample size is not convincing.
16. An insignificant sample size does not allow us to come to a definitive conclusion.
17. The headline is: SURVEY SHOWS PERCENTAGE OF PEOPLE IN 21 COUNTRIES WHO EXPRESS OPTIMISM ABOUT THE WORLD.
